alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 24 at 5:23PM MST until July 24 at 6:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Maricopa County in south central Arizona... Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 630 PM MST. * At 523 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 11 miles south of Big Horn to 10 miles southeast of Freeman to 16 miles northeast of Kaka to 10 miles southwest of Chui-Chu, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 116 and 171. AZ Route 238 between mile markers 1 and 9, and near mile marker 16. AZ Route 85 between mile markers 119 and 122. Locations impacted include... Gila Bend, Freeman, Big Horn, Bosque, Kaka, Stanfield and Ak- Chin Village. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
